required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Multi-strain Synbiotic Versus a Multi-strain Probiotic in Premature Infants
clinical_study.official_title: A Randomized Controlled Trial on a Multi-strain Synbiotic vs. a Multi-strain Probiotic on Fecal Colonization in the Very Low Birth Weight Infant

brief_summary.textblock: The aims are to 1) compare two probiotic treatments (multi-strain synbiotic vs. multi-strain probiotic) on bifidobacteria fecal colonization counts at 1, 2, 3, and 4 weeks of life, 34 weeks corrected gestation age (CGA) ; 2) compare infants successfully colonized with probiotic organisms to infants not successfully colonized at 1, 2, 3, and 4 weeks of life, 34 weeks CGA on infant outcomes and on stress biomarker patterns at birth, day of life (DOL) 1, DOL 7; 3) determine long-term safety and outcomes of probiotic treatments at 6, 16, and 24 months CGA.

detailed_description.textblock: Feeding Intolerance and other GI issues are a major concern in a NICU hospitalized population. Successful colonization with probiotic bacteria is thought to impact the incidence of GI related issues. This study will study the impact of prebiotics on the colonization of a population of VLBW infants in the NICU setting.

clinical_study.why_stopped: Pending further safety information regarding polysaccharides and premature infants

study_design_info.masking: Quadruple (Participant, Care Provider, Investigator, Outcomes Assessor)

primary_outcome.measure: compare a multi-strain synbiotic vs. a multi-strain probiotic on mean bifidobacteria fecal colonization counts
compare a multi-strain synbiotic vs. a multi-strain probiotic on mean bifidobacteria fecal colonization counts
compare a multi-strain synbiotic vs. a multi-strain probiotic on mean bifidobacteria fecal colonization counts
compare a multi-strain synbiotic vs. a multi-strain probiotic on mean bifidobacteria fecal colonization counts
compare a multi-strain synbiotic vs. a multi-strain probiotic on mean bifidobacteria fecal colonization counts
primary_outcome.description: Infants will be given the synbiotic or probiotic supplementation within the first week of life (upon inititation of enteral feedings) until approximately 34 weeks corrected gestational age.

secondary_outcome.measure: Compare the difference between two groups (multi-strain synbiotic vs. multi-strain probiotic) on demographic data and selected standard clinical infant outcomes.
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From birth to NICU discharge (average 36 weeks corrected gestational age)
secondary_outcome.description: Two probiotic groups will be compared on demographics: mean [birth wt(g), birth length(cm), birth hc(cm), GA at birth, 1-& 5- minute APGAR scores], race, gender, prenatal antibiotics(y/n), and enteral feeding type(breastmilk, formula, both); and on selected infant outcomes: Feeding Intolernce(number of times the feeding care plan is disrupted), NEC(y/n), late-onset sepsis(y/n), IVH(y/n;Grade I-IV), PDA(y/n), CLD(y/n), mean [endotracheal ventilation(days), inspired oxygen, discharge wt(g),discharge length(cm), discharge hc(cm), days to reach full feedings, length of stay, days on antibiotics].

secondary_outcome.measure: Compare the difference bewteen infants successfully colonized with probiotic organisms (>10^2 colonies on a 10^4-fold dilution plate)to infants not successfully colonized on demographics and selected standard clinical outcomes
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 1 week of life to NICU discharge
secondary_outcome.description: Two colonization groups will be compared on demographics: mean[birth wt(g), birth length(cm),birth hc(cm),GA at birth,1-& 5- minute APGAR scores],race, gender,prenatal antibiotics(y/n),and enteral feeding type(breastmilk, formula, both); and on selected infant outcomes: Feeding Intolernce(number of times the feeding care plan is disrupted), NEC(y/n), late-onset sepsis(y/n), IVH(y/n;Grade I-IV), PDA(y/n), CLD(y/n), mean [endotracheal ventilation(days), inspired oxygen, discharge wt(g),discharge length(cm), discharge hc(cm), days to reach full feedings, length of stay, days on antibiotics].

secondary_outcome.measure: Compare infants successfully colonized with probiotic organisms(>10^2 colonies on a 10^4-fold dilution plate) to infants not successfully colonized on stress biomarker levels
secondary_outcome.time_frame: day of life 1 to day of life 7
secondary_outcome.description: Interquartile ranges of biomarkers will be compared between the two colonization groups. Biomarkers include: serum cortisol(cord blood), salivary cortisol (DOL 1,7), serum 8-hydroxydeoxyguanosine (cord blood), urinary 8-hydroxydeoxyguanosine (DOL 1,7)

secondary_outcome.measure: Compare trends of stress biomarker levels in relation to demographics and selected standard infant outcomes
secondary_outcome.time_frame: day of life 1 to day of life 7
secondary_outcome.description: Interquartile ranges of biomarkers (listed above) will be compared on the demographic data and selected standard infant outcomes (listed above) at each time (DOL 1, 7) and over-time.

secondary_outcome.measure: Compare the difference between the two probiotic treatment groups (multi-strain synbiotic vs. multi-strain probiotic) on longitudinal neurodevelopmental outcomes.
secondary_outcome.description: Appropriate Bayley scales conducted by developmental pediatricians will be used for the neurodevelopmental data.

secondary_outcome.measure: Compare the difference between the two probiotic treatment groups (multi-strain synbiotic vs. multi-strain probiotic) on longitudinal neurodevelopmental outcomes.
secondary_outcome.description: Appropriate Bayley scales conducted by developmental pediatricians will be used for the neurodevelopmental data.

secondary_outcome.measure: Compare the difference between the two probiotic treatment groups (multi-strain synbiotic vs. multi-strain probiotic) on longitudinal neurodevelopmental outcomes.
secondary_outcome.description: Appropriate Bayley scales conducted by developmental pediatricians will be used for the neurodevelopmental data.

intervention.description: Multi-strain Synbiotic: 1.5 billion CFU of Lactobacillus acidophilus, Bifidobacterium bifidum,and Bifidobacterium lactis WITH galacto-oligosaccharide(GOS)/fructo-oligosaccharide (FOS) combination at 1g/dL (0.9g/dL GOS/ 0.1g/dL FOS)

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- infants with a birth weight < 1500g
- admission to NICU at The Nebraska Medical Center
Exclusion Criteria:
- infants who have congenital anomalies
- have a diagnosis of a congenital metabolic disease
- are made a ward of the State or
- are born to a mother < 19 years of age
